metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9816 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: A possible vulnerability exists where type confusion can occur when manipulating JavaScript objects in object groups, allowing for the bypassing of security checks within these groups. *Note: this vulnerability has only been demonstrated with UnboxedObjects, which are disabled by default on all supported releases.*. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 60.7, Firefox < 67, and Firefox ESR < 60.7.

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '67.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3').
